[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: create_account()] [URL Injection] Can an attacker craft a malicious AccountAddress containing special characters or URL-encoded payloads that bypass query parameter sanitization in the format string at line 62, allowing injection of additional query parameters to manipulate faucet behavior or extract sensitive data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: fund()] [URL Injection] Does the query string construction at line 88 properly sanitize the AccountAddress parameter, or can an attacker inject malicious query parameters (e.g., '&admin=true&amount=999999999') through specially crafted addresses to escalate privileges or manipulate funding amounts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: create_account()] [Path Traversal] Can the faucet_url be manipulated to include path traversal sequences before calling set_path('mint') at line 61, allowing attackers to target arbitrary endpoints on the faucet server and potentially access administrative functions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: fund()] [SSRF Attack] If faucet_url is controlled by an attacker or comes from untrusted configuration, can they redirect requests to internal services by manipulating the base URL, enabling Server-Side Request Forgery to access internal Aptos infrastructure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: fund()] [Integer Overflow] Does the u64 amount parameter at line 85 check for maximum values, or can an attacker request u64::MAX tokens causing integer overflow in the faucet's balance tracking or blockchain state, potentially leading to unlimited token minting? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: fund()] [Amount Manipulation] Can an attacker exploit the string formatting of amount at line 88 to inject negative numbers, scientific notation, or floating-point values that get misinterpreted by the faucet server, bypassing funding limits or causing state inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: mint()] [Double Funding] In the mint() function at lines 113-117, can concurrent calls to the same address exploit race conditions between create_account() and fund() calls to receive multiple funding allocations before the first transaction confirms? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: create_account()] [Zero Amount Bypass] Does setting amount=0 at line 62 have special handling on the faucet server, or can it bypass rate limiting, CAPTCHA requirements, or other anti-abuse mechanisms while still creating valid accounts? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: with_auth_token()] [Token Storage] Is the token field at line 15 stored securely in memory, or can it be leaked through debug output, error messages, or memory dumps, allowing unauthorized access to privileged faucet operations? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: build_and_submit_request()] [Token Injection] Can an attacker inject malicious headers or modify the Bearer token format at line 125 to bypass authentication checks, escalate privileges, or perform header injection attacks against the faucet server? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: build_and_submit_request()] [Missing Token Check] When token is None at line 124, does the faucet server properly reject unauthorized requests, or can attackers exploit missing authentication to drain funds without authorization? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: new()] [Token Leakage] Since FaucetClient is created without a token by default at line 19, can token be accidentally logged or exposed in error messages when operations fail, leaking sensitive authentication credentials? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: build_and_submit_request()] [Content-Length Bypass] Does setting 'content-length: 0' at line 123 create vulnerabilities where the faucet server misinterprets POST requests, potentially allowing request smuggling or bypassing request validation? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: fund()] [HTTP Method Confusion] Does using POST at line 123 for mint operations prevent CSRF attacks, or can attackers craft GET requests with query parameters that the faucet server incorrectly processes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: create_account()] [Hex Decoding Attack] Can a malicious faucet server return invalid hex strings at line 72 containing embedded null bytes, control characters, or overlength data that bypass hex::decode validation and corrupt subsequent BCS deserialization? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: create_account()] [Transaction Replacement] Between receiving the transaction at line 74 and waiting for confirmation at line 76-79, can an attacker submit a conflicting transaction with the same sequence number to replace the faucet transaction?
